subject: Physical Fitness
title: Fiber Type and Athletic Talent
description: One-minute skill: Fiber Type and Athletic Talent.

hook.text: Usain Bolt couldn't run a competitive marathon. Eliud Kipchoge couldn't win a 100-meter dash.

buildup.text: Fiber type ratios vary dramatically between individuals â€” and between populations with different ancestry.

discovery.text: West African sprinters tend toward high fast-twitch percentages. East African runners lean slow-twitch.

twist.text: But genetics only opens the door. Without years of specific training, talent stays potential.

climax.text: Most people sit in the middle â€” roughly 50/50. That's actually ideal for general fitness versatility.

punchline.text: Your fiber mix sets the ceiling. Training decides how close you get.

quiz.question: What fiber type ratio do most average people have?
